content.user_title: Monitor Proxmox cluster health and resources
content.value_statement: Managing Proxmox cluster infrastructure requires checking multiple nodes and resources manually. This skill provides a unified interface to monitor node status, track cluster quorum, and analyze resource utilization across your virtualization platform.
actual_capabilities: List all nodes in the Proxmox cluster
Monitor individual node status and health metrics
Track cluster resources including VMs and containers
limitations: Requires Proxmox VE API credentials with read access
Does not modify cluster configuration or node settings
Limited to information available through Proxmox API

use_cases.title: Cluster health monitoring
use_cases.description: Regularly check node status, quorum, and resource utilization across the Proxmox cluster

use_cases.title: Capacity planning
use_cases.description: Analyze current resource usage and identify bottlenecks for infrastructure scaling decisions

use_cases.title: Troubleshooting assistance
use_cases.description: Quickly identify offline nodes, resource constraints, and performance issues across the cluster

prompt_templates.title: Basic cluster status
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the status of all cluster nodes in my Proxmox environment

prompt_templates.title: Health verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Is the cluster healthy and properly configured? What's the quorum status?

prompt_templates.title: Resource analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: What's the resource utilization across the cluster? Which nodes have capacity issues?

prompt_templates.title: Infrastructure report
prompt_templates.prompt: Get a complete cluster infrastructure report including node status, resources, and recommendations

output_examples.input: Show me the status of all cluster nodes and identify any issues
output: Node pve-01: Online, CPU 45%, Memory 62%, Storage 78%
Node pve-02: Online, CPU 38%, Memory 55%, Storage 71%
Node pve-03: Online, CPU 52%, Memory 48%, Storage 65%
Node pve-04: Offline - check network connectivity
Warning: pve-04 has been offline for 2 hours
Recommendation: Investigate pve-04 network issue before it affects quorum

best_practices: Monitor cluster health regularly and set up alerts for node offline events
Maintain proper node quorum with at least 3 nodes for high availability
Balance resource allocation across nodes to avoid hotspots
anti_patterns: Waiting for nodes to fail before checking cluster status
Ignoring resource utilization warnings until services are impacted
Making configuration changes without documenting cluster state first

faq.question: What Proxmox versions are supported?
faq.answer: Works with Proxmox VE 7.x and 8.x versions that expose the cluster API endpoints.

faq.question: What permissions does the API user need?
faq.answer: Read-only access to cluster resources, nodes, and status information is sufficient.

faq.question: How frequently can I check cluster status?
faq.answer: API polling should respect Proxmox rate limits; avoid excessive requests within short timeframes.

faq.question: Is my cluster data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: All data stays within your environment; the skill only queries your Proxmox API locally.

faq.question: What if a node appears offline?
faq.answer: Check network connectivity between nodes and verify the pveproxy service is running on the affected node.

faq.question: How does this compare to Proxmox web UI?
faq.answer: Provides conversational access to the same data with AI-powered analysis and recommendations.
